publicationXrefe3b.standardName: Pathways and control of ketone body metabolism: on the fringe of lipid biochemistry.

pathway.author: [MaintBot, Thomas, Khanspers, Ddigles, Mkutmon, Egonw, Eweitz]

comments.content:
Ketone bodies are three water-soluble compounds that are produced as by-products when fatty acids are broken down for energy in the liver and kidney. They are used as a source of energy in the heart and brain. In the brain, they are a vital source of energy during fasting.

Source: [[wikipedia:Ketone_bodies|Wikipedia]]
This pathway was inferred from Homo sapiens pathway [http://wikipathways.org/instance/WP311_r68921 WP311(68921)]  with a 100.0% conversion rate.
